title: 113_hr1411
content: The curr_chunk is a section header titled "SHORT TITLE; DEFINITIONS." The Act is titled the "California Coastal National Monument Expansion Act of 2013" and defines terms like "map," "Monument," "Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands," and "Presidential Proclamation 7264." Proclamation Number 7264, dated January 11, 2000, defines the term "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior. The Act aims to protect and enhance the historical, natural, cultural, and recreational values of the Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands while allowing certain activities like grazing to continue. It also includes the expansion of the California Coastal National Monument. The Act expands the boundary of the Monument to include Federal land, with the Secretary required to file a map and boundary description to the Senate and House committees. The map and description will have the same legal effect as the Act, with the Secretary allowed to correct minor errors. The boundary description for the Monument expansion must be filed and available for public inspection at Bureau of Land Management offices. SEC. 4. ADMINISTRATION. The Secretary shall manage the land added to the Monument in accordance with Presidential Proclamation 7264, allowing for traditional economic activities like grazing. Lands not owned by the United States within the proposed addition will not be part of the monument unless acquired through donation or exchange with the landowner's consent. A management plan must be developed within 2 years. The Secretary must finalize an amendment to the Monument management plan within 2 years, allowing for public participation and outlining appropriate land uses. Motorized and mechanized vehicles are restricted to designated roads and trails in the Monument, except for emergencies or authorized purposes. The Secretary has the authority to acquire non-Federal land for incorporation into the Monument. The Secretary may acquire non-Federal land adjacent to the Monument through exchange or donation with written consent. Any acquired land shall be added to and managed as part of the Monument. Access by motorized vehicles to non-Federal lands within the Monument must not be restricted. The Act does not restrict overflights, including low-level overflights or military, commercial, and general aviation overflights within the Monument. It also does not affect law enforcement authorities of the Department of Homeland Security or Native American rights. The expansion of the Monument does not establish buffer zones or protective perimeters. Activities outside the Monument visible or audible within the Monument boundary are not precluded. Grazing of livestock and maintenance of structures for grazing within the Point Arena-Stornetta Public Lands or the Monument are unaffected. The Monument will be managed as part of the National Landscape Conservation System. The House of Representatives passed the bill on July 22, 2013. Karen L. Haas is the Clerk.
